intro: Gastridium australe, commonly known as the Australian starburry, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Gastridium australe is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
